intro: Adenopeltis serrata, commonly known as the serrated adenopeltis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish flowers that are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Adenopeltis serrata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
